title: Denial of Service | twitter.com & mobile.twitter.com

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Team,

Detail:
I found a DoS that works on **twitter.com** and **mobile.twitter.com**, but it doesn't work on the mobile app. The user only needs to view the message or tweet in order to be exposed to this DoS. As far as I can remember, a report similar to this report has been sent to you before, but I think it's no longer public.

Note:
- If the user tries to view the DoS message or tweet from twitter.com, DoS will definitely work, but if it enters from Chrome and displays this DoS from **mobil.twitter.com**, this DoS will not work. This works without exception in Edge and Firefox.

- I think this is a browser-based DoS, so I think it won't work on Desktop Twitter. So I didn't test it.

- I did my tests on my own accounts. I haven't done a test for any tag. But I'm sure it will work.


PoC & Steps:
`http://twitter.com:627732462`



{F875527}

## Impact

An attacker could apply this DoS to any Twitter account or popular tag. It prevents a large audience or target user from accessing Twitter from the browser.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi Team,

Detail:
I found a DoS that works on twitter.com and mobile.twitter.com, but it doesn't work on the mobile app. The user only needs to view the message or tweet in order to be exposed to this DoS. As far as I can remember, a report similar to this report has been sent to you before, but I think it's no longer public.

Note:

  • If the user tries to view the DoS message or tweet from twitter.com, DoS will definitely work, but if it enters from Chrome and displays this DoS from mobil.twitter.com, this DoS will not work. This works without exception in Edge and Firefox.

  • I think this is a browser-based DoS, so I think it won't work on Desktop Twitter. So I didn't test it.

  • I did my tests on my own accounts. I haven't done a test for any tag. But I'm sure it will work.

PoC & Steps:
http://twitter.com:627732462

Impact

An attacker could apply this DoS to any Twitter account or popular tag. It prevents a large audience or target user from accessing Twitter from the browser.

activities.markdown_message:
I found the report I mentioned: https://hackerone.com/reports/500686, The problem is the same but more effective. Because it works on twitter.com and mobile.twitter.com.

Thanks!
@cyanpiny

activities.message: I said above that mobile.twitter.com did not crash in chrome. This is valid on the old version of mobile.twitter.com. So DoS attack succeeds in its new version.
activities.markdown_message: I said above that mobile.twitter.com did not crash in chrome. This is valid on the old version of mobile.twitter.com. So DoS attack succeeds in its new version.

activities.message:
Thank you for your report @cyanpiny ,

Please keep in mind that "*Issues that result in Denial of Service (DoS) to Twitter's servers at the network or application layer.*" are explicitly out of scope as per our [program rules](https://hackerone.com/twitter). While we will be closing this report, we appreciate you taking the time to submit this report and encourage you to continue searching for vulnerabilities.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.
activities.markdown_message:

While we will be closing this report, we appreciate you taking the time to submit this report and encourage you to continue searching for vulnerabilities.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

activities.message:
Hi @bugtriage-christian,

I think this report has been closed as Informative by mistake. This is a client side DoS and complies with your program rules. You are probably confused by the problem in this report. #819088
{F877704}


In order to indicate the effect of this DoS, I can say the following:
- If the attacker wishes to apply this DoS comment on a tweet of Trump, Trump cannot use Twitter.
- If an attacker applies this comment to a tag, everyone viewing the tag will crash Twitter.
- If the attacker creates an ad campaign on Twitter and shows this ad to all users, all Twitter users will crash.

This is a client-side DoS, so it may take weeks or months to find out what this DoS is caused by. It is not easily detected like network DoS.

Thanks!
@cyanpiny

This is a client-side DoS, so it may take weeks or months to find out what this DoS is caused by. It is not easily detected like network DoS.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message:
Hi,
Have you applied any fix for this? I cannot send a DoS message from the browser.
But I can do this again using the mobile app.
{F882331}

Also, since this report has been reopened, there are a few technical details that I forgot to add.

- You can use any url to run this DoS. http://google.com:5656565656556, http://facebook.com:656565656565 etc. This has nothing to do with the twitter domain.

- Possibly twitter.com checks urls in shared tweets. But a port of this length seems to be having problems parsing the url.
The ideal way to solve this: limit the port length as popular web sites do (max: 5, is recommended.) URLs that do not match this length should not be a valid url.

Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi,
Have you applied any fix for this? I cannot send a DoS message from the browser.
But I can do this again using the mobile app.

Also, since this report has been reopened, there are a few technical details that I forgot to add.

  • You can use any url to run this DoS. http://google.com:5656565656556, http://facebook.com:656565656565 etc. This has nothing to do with the twitter domain.

  • Possibly twitter.com checks urls in shared tweets. But a port of this length seems to be having problems parsing the url.
    The ideal way to solve this: limit the port length as popular web sites do (max: 5, is recommended.) URLs that do not match this length should not be a valid url.

Thanks!

activities.message: Update: This is also working on Desktop Twitter. In this case it will not only work on the mobile app and on the old version of mobile.twitter.com.
activities.markdown_message: Update: This is also working on Desktop Twitter. In this case it will not only work on the mobile app and on the old version of mobile.twitter.com.

activities.message: Thanks again. As mentioned we’ll keep you updated as we investigate further. As a reminder, please remember to keep the details of this report private until we have fully investigated and addressed the issue.

activities.message: Thanks for bounty. I can no longer share a tweet or message causing DoS. But I can RT the tweets I sent in the past.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for bounty. I can no longer share a tweet or message causing DoS. But I can RT the tweets I sent in the past.

activities.message:
Hi, there has never been any correction and impact reduction. Only a 10 character port can be shared.
this works:
`http://google.com:1234567890`

you cannot share this:
`http://google.com:12345678901`

activities.message:
Hello Team, first of all I know that you are very busy due to the hacking incident. But I think this report that I sent is just as important. (Almost) Because if the attacker had learned this. He would apply a DoS to the comments of his tweets and to @TwitterSupport. Thus, it was not immediately understandable that this was an attack. So more people would be affected!

I advise you to put the 2 reports I sent you to the priority. (this and #921286)

Thank you.
@cyanpiny
